game

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Player, Projectile

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    It is used as an abstract class, and contains all the methods that all objects within the game will use.
    Author:
    Clayton Nida

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(int x,
                  int y,
                  int id)
        Constructs a GameObject with the given x and y locations, and with the given ID number.
        Parameters:
        x - Starting x location.
        y - Starting y location.
        id - Given ID number.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public abstract void tick()
        This is the method that will be called to "tick" the object. Each object will have different logic that will be used after tick is called.

      • render

        public abstract void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This will be used to draw the images needed. Depending on each GameObject, different things will be rendered. Example: players will have their models rendered, and level will have maps and platforms rendered.
        Parameters:
        g - The given Graphics object that will be used to draw/render all images.

      • setX

        public void setX(int x)
        This will move this GameObject to the given X location.
        Parameters:
        x - X value to set this GameObject to.

      • setY

        public void setY(int y)
        This will move this GameObject to the given Y location.
        Parameters:
        y - Y value to set this GameObject to.

      • setJumped

        public void setJumped(int jumped)
        This will set the number of times a GameObject has jumped.
        Parameters:
        jumped - The number of times this GameObject has jumped.

      • getJumped

        public int getJumped()
        Returns:
        Returns the number of times a GameObject has jumped.

      • setDoubleJumped

        public void setDoubleJumped(boolean doubleJumped)
        This will set the status of a GameObject's doubleJumped to true or false.
        Parameters:
        doubleJumped - Boolean value saying whether or not a GameObject has double jumped.

      • getDoubleJumped

        public boolean getDoubleJumped()
        Returns:
        Whether or not a GameObject has double jumped.

      • setID

        public void setID(int id)
        Changes a GameObject's ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The number that this GameObject's ID will be set to.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns:
        Returns the X location of this GameObject.

      • getID

        public int getID()

        Returns the ID of this GameObject.

      • setSpeedX

        public void setSpeedX(int speedX)
        This will set the speed that this GameObject is moving horizontally.
        Parameters:
        speedX - The speed that this GameObject will move in pixels.

      • setSpeedY

        public void setSpeedY(int speedY)
        This will set the speed that this GameObject is moving vertically.
        Parameters:
        speedY - The speed that this GameObject will move in pixels.
